title: Trump Says U.S. Seized Oil Tanker Off Venezuelan Coast
summary: The seizure comes as the United States builds up its forces in the Caribbean as part of a campaign against President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela.

title: María Corina Machado Appears in Norway After Missing Nobel Ceremony
summary: María Corina Machado, who spent over a year in hiding in Venezuela, greeted supporters in Oslo, hours after her daughter accepted the Nobel Peace Prize in her name.

title: Oil Tanker U.S. Seized Off Venezuela Has Faked Its Location Before, Data Shows
summary: The ship has frequently carried oil from countries under U.S. sanctions, and its tracking data shows multiple recent trips to Iran and Venezuela.

title: House Gives Bipartisan Approval to $900 Billion Defense Bill
summary: The legislation codifies President Trump’s agenda but includes a few measures challenging his policies and insisting on more consultation with Congress.

title: Defense Bill Will Make D.C. Skies Less Safe, N.T.S.B. Chair Says
summary: The chair of the National Transportation Safety Board warned that a provision in the new defense bill would worsen the risk of midair collisions near the Washington-area airport where a deadly crash in January killed 67 people.

title: What Is a Trump Gold Card? Applications Open for Million-Dollar Visas.
summary: President Trump has framed the program as a way for the government to raise billions of dollars and prioritize the admission of successful entrepreneurs and investors.

title: After Shutdown, Democrats Claim Credit for Funding They Opposed
summary: Several Democrats who fought to steer federal money to their states and districts have boasted about their success even after voting against the bill that provided the funds.

title: As the Price of Beef Soars, Restaurants Are in ‘Code Red’ Mode
summary: Midpriced steakhouses and fine-dining establishments are trying to figure out how to cover their rising costs without scaring away customers.

title: Mexico Approves 50% Tariffs on Many Chinese Imports
summary: The tariffs will apply to goods from China and other nations. Washington has been pressuring Mexico to move away from dealing with China.

title: The Fed Cut Rates Again but Deep Divisions Cloud Path Ahead
summary: The central bank’s decision to lower interest rates for a third straight meeting was highly contentious, reflecting an internal divide that will likely limit how much borrowing costs will fall next year.

title: What Menopause Does to the Body
summary: A head-to-toe guide to the many unexpected symptoms of the midlife transition.

title: What Could Thwart the Texas G.O.P. From Picking Up 5 House Seats in Midterm Elections
summary: Republicans redid their voting map so they could flip five seats to help keep control of the U.S. House. But achieving that goal is far from guaranteed.

title: The Conservative Overhaul of the University of Texas Is Underway
summary: The school has been brought to heel by conservative critics of higher education. It is part of a broader transformation at the state’s universities.

title: A Surrogacy Firm Told Parents-to-Be Their Money Was Safe. Suddenly, It Vanished.
summary: Surro Connections held itself out as a reliable business. Now, clients have lost as much as tens of thousands of dollars meant to compensate women carrying their pregnancies.

title: Former King Juan Carlos I of Spain, Seeking Relevance, Publishes Book
summary: King Juan Carlos I of Spain abdicated and left for exile years ago. Now, his attempted comeback is giving his family a royal headache.

title: Louvre Heist Was Caught on Film, Officials Say, Rebutting Earlier Account
summary: Investigators said that a security camera recorded thieves preparing to burgle the Louvre. The museum’s director said previously that the camera was facing the wrong way.

title: Khmer Rouge-Era Land Mines Have a Big Role in Thailand-Cambodia Conflict
summary: Thailand says ordnance replanted by Cambodia has injured or maimed more than a dozen of its soldiers. Cambodia rejects the accusation.

title: Sophie Kinsella, ‘Confessions of a Shopaholic’ Author, Dies at 55
summary: Writing under a pseudonym, Madeleine Wickham cultivated an international following for her series centered on a young woman addicted to shopping.

title: What Trump’s National Security Strategy Gets Right About Europe
summary: It’s an actual place, not an arbitrarily bounded zone.

title: The Health Care Debate We Really Need
summary: The high cost of health care in America is suppressing wages, driving job losses and fueling inequality.

title: Washington Faces Heavy Rain and Flooding From Atmospheric River
summary: Tens of thousands of residents in Washington were poised to evacuate, as days of heavy rain sends rivers bursting over their banks.

title: How to Fight Rising Utility Bills? Take Over the Company, Activists Say.
summary: A grass-roots coalition is trying to push New York State to use eminent domain to buy out Central Hudson Gas & Electric and replace it with a public authority.

title: Wenne Alton Davis, Actor in ‘Marvelous Mrs. Maisel,’ Hit by S.U.V. and Killed
summary: The actor, 60, was struck by a vehicle in Midtown Manhattan late on Monday, her agent and the police said.

title: Nursing Home Owners Pocketed Millions as Patients Suffered, Report Says
summary: As the owners intentionally understaffed two New Jersey facilities and diverted Medicaid money for their own use, residents in the homes “suffered unnecessarily,” the state comptroller said.
